info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Haywood and southwestern Buncombe Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 630 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Downtown Asheville, or near Enka. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Canton, Bent Creek, Enka, Mount Pisgah, B.R. Parkway-Mount Pisgah To The Nc Arboretum, Leicester, West Asheville, B.R. Parkway-Nc Arboretum To East Asheville, Candler and Cruso. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
